Meeting 2022-01-25T17:00:00+01:00 (T-13min)

Agenda:

  • Add --explain flag to explain lints clippy#8291
  • ...?
Meeting time :wave: @T-clippy
The issue linked above should be a quick read.
Are there any objections on adding this?
Strong :+1: from my side.
Same :+1:
I think we might have to adjust some parts of the documentation to look nice inside the terminal, but that's an implementation detail
I assume the best behavior would be if the flag would dump the lint documentation
That would likely be the best starting point.
But it doesn't need to be the end of it.
I think it's better to only have one detailed description for both the online and offline docs
There may be some things that fit better into online docs than on terminal or vice versa.
We could optionally also give a --explain-short variant that just dumps the string line in the lint declaration
Still we should start out with using the same docs for both and change things if or when the need arises.
Maybe, the formatting will also have to be a bit different. In the console version we should probably parse some of the documentation and remove inline markdown links for instance

Good point. What I don't want to do is to duplicate the documentation. I don't think the documentation is readily available in a field of the Lint struct. So we may have to change our declare_clippy_lint! macro
I would want to avoid anything that makes documenting lints harder.

flip1995 said:

Good point. What I don't want to do is to duplicate the documentation. I don't think the documentation is readily available in a field of the Lint struct. So we may have to change our declare_clippy_lint! macro

Do you mean manually duplicate or in general?
I'm not sure if we should use a proc macro to extract the doc comment and include it as string or if there is another more elegant way though.
While #".."# strings might be a workable alternative, doc comments have served us very well in the past.

xFrednet said:

flip1995 said:

Good point. What I don't want to do is to duplicate the documentation. I don't think the documentation is readily available in a field of the Lint struct. So we may have to change our declare_clippy_lint! macro

Do you mean manually duplicate or in general?

In general. Even copying automatically all of the documentation to a file which is then used for the --explain output sounds rather bad. That probably leads to many merge conflicts
True, if it would be automatically copied I would not include that file in git but rather build a mechanism for it. This was just a thought though :)
We could use one generated file per lint, but I doubt that would give us much benefit over just using a small proc macro to copy the doc comments into a string.
Yeah, I also think modifying the declare_clippy_lint! macro or writing a proc macro is the best approach here.
That proc macro could also include all the markdown mangling we need.
Good point :+1:
This sounds like a fun little project :)
Yeah, I'd love to tackle that.

xFrednet said:

This sounds like a fun little project :)

That you won't start while writing on your bachelor thesis!
It's been a few weeks since I wrote my last proc maro. :-D
Ok, I'll take it.
Great thanks @llogiq !
Thank you folks for coming up with such a fun project :grinning:
I think that's all for this week @triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
You have to thank @matthiaskrgr :smiley:
I do.
I think if we expand the macro we should switch to the to @Cameron Steffen suggestion to unify the declare_clippy_lint macro in clippy#6830
I also wanted to add some functionality to the macro for the nightly lints

flip1995 said:

xFrednet said:

This sounds like a fun little project :)

That you won't start while writing on your bachelor thesis!

True, the deadline is in sight and I'm slowly getting there. I'm so looking forward to a few free weeks afterwards and some issues I have kept track of. Thanks for tackling this @llogiq
I'll also have to do some beta backports this week. (I think there are 2 ICE fixes we can backport and the useless_format fix that got backported to stable already)
But that's it then for today, thanks for attending! :wave:
Have a good week everyone! :wave:
do we still have Google calendar invites for meeting dates? i keep forgetting :sweat_smile:
Yes we do. If you give me your email, I can resend you the invite
i think we had this at some point a year ago or so
